marklogic.body: About a year ago, I picked up a book called 'Eat to Live' by Dr. Joel Fuhrman, that advocates nutrient-dense eating (mostly fruits and vegetables). I lost 50 lbs., became 'un-diabetic' and lowered my LDL into the normal range for the first time in years. When I relax and eat more processed carbs and sugar, the weight starts coming right back. From my experience, I'm fully convinced that the real villains in cardio-vascular disease and diabetes are processed carbs and sugar. Fuhrman would have you avoid all cooking oils, which would get your omega 6/3 ratio into a much healthier range. Weight Gain, bad lipid scores, elevated glucose and blood pressure are just our body's way of telling us that our diet and lifestyle need improvements. It'll be a great day when the medical community leads with sound nutritional counseling instead of a prescription for statins.
